medical_history.chief_complaint: Nausea and vomiting with right lower quadrant (RLQ) pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Nausea and vomiting started at 7 PM last night, initially ignored but persisted. Around midnight, mid-abdominal pain began, which intensified and localized to the RLQ. Subjective fevers and chills were noted. No diarrhea or blood in stools.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Ulcerative colitis without significant flare-ups in past years, ADD, childhood asthma, mild seasonal allergies, osteopenia treated with bisphosphonates, lactose intolerance.
medical_history.family_history: Father with diabetes and obesity; Grandfather with gastrointestinal symptoms, unclear what; No history of colon cancer or other gastrointestinal disease.
